intro: Bupleurum apiculatum f. urumoffii, commonly known as the Urumqi Bupleurum, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Xinjiang region of China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the arid climate of its native environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its natural range.
